review: I couldn't be happier now that I've dropped Tine Warner Cable's overpriced cable and switched to Amazon Fire TV. I already had a Prime account as well as Netflix so all I had to do was sign-up for Sling TV with the discount coupon and then only paid $50 for Fire TV. I can still watch BBC news through their app, listen to the music I've purchased, and I am going to look into some of the games as well. The only thing that you really need to know because it don't remember seeing it when I ordered it is you need an optic cable for audio. I already had one so it wasn't a big deal but if I didn't I would have had to go back and order/purchase one.My dad wanted to drop DirecTV and I told him about Amazon Fire. He ended up returning the Chrome TV stick he got because it didn't support as much and got the Amazon Fire Stick since he TV doesn't have an optic port, just HDMI. He loves it too and we're both glad for all the money saved through no longer having cable/satellite providers!

review: I was using the Amazon Fire Stick on my tv but Netflix and Hulu would continuously "buffer". Sometimes the picture would stall and I would just get audio. Sometimes everything stalled. I even changed internet providers from Frontier to TWC and it did not work. So as a last ditch effort I switched to Amazon Fire TV. It was a bit more expensive than the stick but it seems to stream much better. Hope it stays that way!
